Text:
Hey there, Alpha. Hope the investigation went well.
Shall we share our findings?
...Would you mind going first?

Sure, no problem. Except, we weren't able to turn up
anything about this "Cid" guy you're after.
I see...

Apart from that, apparently the currency of this
world is called "zeni". Needless to say, we've never
heard of it.

They use the same currency where Delta and I are
from. But in our rush to get here, we neglected to
bring any with us.
Speaking of, where is Delta?

I sent her to find food, thinking we might be forced
to camp for a while. Sadly, it seems I was right.

Ugh, camping? Can't say I'm looking forward to it.
I'm an indoor type.

*sigh* A tough situation, but I suppose there's not
much we can do about it. So, is that all you have to
report, Alpha?

No, there's more. It's about these "levels" and
"stats" you mentioned.

It appears these concepts don't exist here. No matter
how many monsters we slew, there were no "experience
points" to be found.

Which means it's all about player skill. Hehe, now
this I like!
I get that, but what about the skills we used in SLF?
That's not something I would know, is it?
T-True enough...

In that case, shall we conduct a few tests in the
forest while we set up camp?

That will likely tell us whether we can use our
skills or not, and I'd like to check our damage
output without levels or stats.
Agreed! You in, Alpha?

Yes. Now that we're working together, your safety is
my responsibility.

Then it's decided. Tests...and hunting for tonight's
dinner! Let's go!

Boar, rabbit, and wild herbs... That ought to make a
decent enough meal.

Hold on, Sunraku. Aren't you forgetting why we came
here in the first place?

Good work, you three. Nice moves back there. So those
techniques you used occasionally... Were those your
"skills"?

Yup, very observant of you. Looks like we can still
use them here.

Although they're a little tough to use since we
can't see our recast times or HP changes... But,
that's where experience and instinct come into play.

Right. It's better than not being able to use them at
all, and that's enough.

Now that we've figured that out, maybe we should
start making camp—

...Wait, we came here without telling Delta. Do you
think she'll be okay?

Yes, no need to worry about her. In fact, she should
be back soon—
BOSS MAN!!!

See? For a nose as keen as hers, tracking my scent is
a simple matter—
...Wait, did you just say "boss man"?
I did! But...where is he?
What'd I tell ya? She's no good.
What'd you say?! I am very good!

But I smelled metal and heard it too, so maybe my
nose isn't working right...

I have faith in your senses, Delta. It's possible
that we encountered him without knowing it.
Does that ring a bell to anyone?

Hmm, let's see... I did talk to this one NPC with
black hair that gave me the cold shoulder.
Could that be...?!

But this guy seemed pretty weak—not at all like you
described. Just really average.
Hmm... That's not much to go on.
This one NPC that spoke to me was nice enough.
Boss man is definitely nice!

He felt kinda ordinary to me, though... More weak
than anything, I guess.
Then that's not Boss man.
I met someone with a bad case of edginess, but he—
He was ill? Cid is the very picture of health.

No, that's not what I mean... He said something
cryptic about watching from the shadows—
Shadows...?!

Black hair, soft-spoken, and says cryptic things...
That has to be Cid! Let's go find him at once!
Yes, ma'am!
...Man, this Cid guy really gets her engine revving.
Not surprising. Alpha is a girl, after all.
Is that why? Anyway, should we go after them?
